TopicTitle: So I found myself whistling the KSP VAB theme and smiling

Articles.Content:
And I thought to myself, "hey, maybe we could have some fun with that!"

Edited November 14, 2015 by quyxkh
question title
I do that waaay Ã¢â‚¬â€¹too much...
I turned off the music over a year ago.
The music to me is like air. I need to hear it once daily to satisfy myself.
Can you add an option in the poll for All day, everyday?
I do it all the time. It really annoys my friends.

It annoys my wife at times... maybe that is why I turned it up

Then again it might be a sign I play to much KSP

It annoys my wife at times... maybe that is why I turned it up

Then again it might be a sign I play to much KSP

This. She especially hates the jazzy detective music in the space hanger.
I play the KSP theme on the piano almost every day!
KSP has music?
I can't even whistle in the first place.

I can't even whistle in the first place.

Me too. I hum it.

I don't like the ambient sounding piece. Besides that I think the music is perfect. I found myself whistling the music too without realizing where it came from

To be honest when I started playing KSP over a year ago I was sure I would mute it forever a few days later. But I didn't. I still really enjoy the jazzy tune. In my opinion Squad should implement some more tunes. Same style, other songs. Because it's really good.

The music is hypnosis.

"Play KSP...Play KSP...Play KSP..."
Occasionally I hear it in my head, typically I don't listen to it though, I just mute the game.
I'm fond of the music in the game, but I can't recall it ever getting stuck in my head the way, for example, the Dwarf Fortress music does. Maybe it's because there's a little more variety.

That music .... I mostly spend time in the SPH so its the jazzy number for me..

Its a sinister coverup.. Attempting to make light of a very serious task.. Like that time I replaced doom midis with dance of the sugarplum fairys tune

For me its replaced with Kevin Mcclouds At Rest tune..
It far more accurately portrays the fact that the train im building is nothing more than a multi segmented detriot diesel death machine and all that board her might never see another sunrise..

And indeed...that gets stuck in my head alot

That sweet jest like xylophone jazziness has no place in my head... It portays one thing generally..

A time vortex of which there is no escape... Minutes turn to hours..hours turn to days

And should it ever be stuck in my head.. I would have aged 20 years in minutes..

Im glad to say it never has:)
I always listen to VAB music when I'm messing with my computer hardware, like installing new HDDs or replacing stuff.
Ive played ksp on slow days and someone sleeping on the couch behind me kept saying how he "liked hearing the little jazzy tune"
What music?
Sometimes I hear the "space waltz" while in bed with the lights off.

I usually turn off the music in most games after a short while, so that I can listen to something else while playing. But I hear the KSP music all the time in KSP videos on youtube too, so I'm never completely away from it. :)

[quote name='Venusgate']KSP has music?[/QUOTE]

This (and no option in the poll for it)

I quite like the swing music that's played, IIRC, in the recruitment centre. I tend to hear some lyrics in my head though, when it hits the 'chorus part: 'Do you think it'll fly, shall we give it a try? C'mon!' I imagine it sung in the sort of style that the Swingle singers used to have (somewhat akin to the folk that sing, for example, the Flinstones theme song)
